R 201500Z NOV 23

MARADMIN 580/23

MSGID/GENADMIN/CMC WASHINGTON DC MRA MM//

SUBJ/FY 2024 APPROVED SELECTIONS TO FIRST SERGEANT AND MASTER SERGEANT//

REF/A/MSGID:MSG/CMC/081912ZJUN20//

REF/B/MSGID:DOC/CMC CMC (MMPB-11)/14JUN2012//

REF/C/MSGID:MSG/CMC/132101ZSEP21//

REF/D/MSGID:MSG/CMC/311730ZOCT22//

NARA/REF A IS MARADMIN 334/20, FORTHCOMING CHANGES TO MCO 1400.32D, MARINE CORPS PROMOTION MANUAL, VOLUME 2, ENLISTED PROMOTIONS. REF B IS MCO P1400.32D W/CH2, MARINE CORPS PROMOTION MANUAL, VOLUME 2, ENLISTED PROMOTIONS. REF C IS MARADMIN 474/21, UPDATED ENLISTED PME REQUIREMENTS BY GRADE. REF D IS MARADMIN 576/22, ANNOUNCEMENT OF THE FY23 SENIOR ENLISTED BLENDED SEMINAR PROGRAM PILOT COURSE//

POC/DANIEL A. MOORE/MAJ/CMC (MMPB-11)/TEL: DSN 278-9710/EMAIL: DANIEL.A.MOORE@USMC.MIL//

POC/CAROLIN CHAVEZ/MSGT/CMC (MMPB-11)/TEL: DSN 278-9718/EMAIL: CAROLIN.CHAVEZ@USMC.MIL//

GENTEXT/REMARKS/1. Marines listed in paragraph 4 will receive appointments to fill vacancies in the selected grade by assigned order of seniority. Separate monthly Marine Administrative Messages (MARADMIN) will announce planned promotions.

2. Only Marines who completed Professional Military Education (PME) requirements prior to the convening of the board were considered.

3. In accordance with reference (a), Marines selected to the ranks of Staff Sergeant through Sergeant Major/Master Gunnery Sergeant, to include meritorious promotions, must have at least 24 months obligated service (OBS) remaining on contract as of the date of their promotion. Marines may take action to gain OBS prior to reaching their seniority number. Marines should engage their Career Planner to satisfy OBS requirements as soon as possible. See paragraph 6 for additional details on OBS.

4. Approved selections below (for proper order read left to right):

6. Obligated Service

6.a. Commanders shall cite this MARADMIN as the authority to locally extend Marines to satisfy OBS requirements.

6.b. Utilize the below table to calculate OBS based on the seniority number and month. Example: Marine selected with a seniority number of 76 would need to have an EAS of 1 March 2026 or later to ensure they have OBS for promotion on 1 March 2024. This is an estimate only, based off monthly promotion MARADMINS there may be instances causing an additional extension to be completed.

6.c. Primary selects must complete required extensions NLT 31 January 2024. If a Marine refuses to extend or reenlist to meet OBS requirement, the commander will inform CMC (MMPB-11) of the Marine’s refusal via naval letter. CMC (MMPB-11) will remove the Marine’s name from the appropriate selection list and the Marine is ineligible for consideration on future promotion boards.

6.d. Commands must contact CMC (MMPB-11) to effect promotion of a Marine on limited duty or pending evaluation by a Physical Evaluation Board.

7. Alternate Selection List

7.a. The board selected 93 alternates. CMC (MMPB-11) will post the alternate list on the Enlisted Promotions unit website.

7.b. Marines selected as alternates will not have a seniority number run in Marine Corps Total Force System (MCTFS). CMC (MMPB-11) will manage the alternate selection list and assign seniority numbers based on service requirements. CMC (MM) may activate an alternate when a primary select cannot effect promotion. If activated, alternates will promote after the primary select list clears.

7.c. Within 10 days of release of this MARADMIN, CMC (MMPB-11) will notify alternates of their selection via a Marine On-Line (MOL) message and post an alphabetized list of alternates on the Enlisted Promotions Unit website.

7.d. Alternates will not incur a failure of selection. A letter annotating selection as an alternate will post to the Marine's Official Military Personnel File (OMPF).

7.e. Alternates must gain OBS within 30 days of activation notification. If a Marine refuses to extend or reenlist to meet OBS requirement, the commander will inform CMC (MMPB-11) of the Marine’s refusal via naval letter. CMC (MMPB-11) will remove the Marine’s name from the alternate selection list and the Marine is ineligible for consideration on future promotion boards.

7.f. CMC (MMPB-11) may approve frocking of an alternate activated for promotion.

7.g. Alternates may receive permanent change of assignment (PCA), or permanent change of station (PCS) orders based on service requirements. All assignment policies remain in effect related to OBS and PCA/PCS orders.

8. Marines listed in paragraph 4 were selected from the IMOS table listed in MARADMINS 407/23, and 453/23. This MARADMIN does not constitute authority to change the Marine's primary MOS where the feeder MOS for a selectee does not provide skill progression to the IMOS.

9. Remedial Promotion Consideration

9.a. Requests for remedial promotion consideration require strict compliance with the provisions of paragraph 3602 of reference (b). Submit requests to the CMC (MMPB-11), organizational mailbox at enlistedpromotions@usmc.mil.

9.b. Marines must explain all actions taken prior to the board convening to demonstrate due diligence required for favorable consideration of remedial promotion requests. Noncompliant requests will not receive favorable consideration.

10. Commanders shall review this MARADMIN and report erroneous selections to CMC (MMPB-11) within 10 days of release of this message detailing the circumstances in accordance with paragraph 1200.4 of reference (b). Examples of erroneous selections include: incorrect date of rank, incorrect MOS, requests to transfer to the Fleet Marine Corps Reserve, or pending/completed disciplinary action in current grade by military or civilian authorities not previously reported.

11. Commanders will immediately notify CMC (MMPB-11) of intent to delay or revoke the selection of any Marine listed in this MARADMIN. Forward requests to delay or revoke promotion via the chain of command up to the first general officer. Requests must include a full written justification for recommendation to delay or revoke and arrive HQMC CMC (MMPB-11) within 30 days after receipt of this MARADMIN. Commanders must ensure the Marine receives an opportunity to review the command's recommendation and submit a statement. Paragraph 5200.3b of reference (b) provides specific language requirements for the opening paragraph of the Marine's statement.

12. Marines considered and not selected may contact the Enlisted Career Counselor CMC (MMPB-24) to receive an evaluation of their OMPF and gain insight on improving their competitiveness. Due to the confidentiality of the selection board process, CMC (MMPB-24) does not provide specific reasons for non-selection. Contact CMC (MMPB-24) for more information at DSN: 278-9241 or commercial (703) 784-9241.

13. This MARADMIN is not applicable to the Marine Corps Reserve.

14. For Enlisted Promotion matters call comm (703) 784-9718 or DSN 278-9718. Email inquiries to: enlistedpromotions@usmc.mil.
